title: Combined Rotation and Advancement Flap Reconstruction for a Defect of the Upper Lip: 2 Cases
patient: A 52-year-old woman presented with a dog bite of the right upper lip. The defect was 4.0×2.2 cm in size. (). A 4.0 cm horizontal incision running laterally from the right corner of the mouth was created. The defect was reconstructed using a combined rotation and advancement flap. There were no significant postoperative complications after surgery ().
